properties.name: clip-path
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
properties.computedValue: as specified, but with <url> values made absolute

values.name: fill-box
values.prose: Uses the object bounding box as reference box.

values.name: stroke-box
values.prose: Uses the stroke bounding box as reference box.

values.name: view-box
values.prose: Uses the nearest SVG viewport as reference box. If a viewBox attribute is specified for the SVG viewport creating element: The reference box is positioned at the origin of the coordinate system established by the viewBox attribute. The dimension of the reference box is set to the width and height values of the viewBox attribute.

properties.name: clip-rule
properties.appliesTo: Applies to SVG graphics elements

values.name: nonzero
values.prose: See description of fill-rule property [SVG11].

values.name: evenodd
values.prose: See description of fill-rule property [SVG11].

properties.name: mask-image
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
properties.computedValue: the keyword none, a computed <image>, or a computed <url>

values.name: <url>
values.prose: A URL reference to a mask element (for example url(commonmasks.svg#mask)) or to a CSS image.

properties.name: mask-mode
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

values.name: alpha
values.prose: A value of alpha indicates that the alpha values of the mask layer image should be used as the mask values. See Calculating mask values.

values.name: luminance
values.prose: A value of luminance indicates that the luminance values of the mask layer image should be used as the mask values. See Calculating mask values.

values.name: match-source
values.prose: If the <mask-reference> of the mask-image property is of type <mask-source> the value specified by the referenced mask elementâ€™s mask-type property must be used. If the <mask-reference> of the mask-image property is of type <image> the alpha values of the mask layer image should be used as the mask values.

properties.name: mask-repeat
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
properties.computedValue: Consists of: two keywords, one per dimension

properties.name: mask-position
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
properties.percentages: refer to size of mask painting area minus size of mask layer image; see text background-position [CSS3BG]
properties.computedValue: Consisting of: two keywords representing the origin and two offsets from that origin, each given as an absolute length (if given a <length>), otherwise as a percentage.

properties.name: mask-clip
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

values.name: content-box
values.prose: The painted content is restricted to (clipped to) the content box.

values.name: padding-box
values.prose: The painted content is restricted to (clipped to) the padding box.

values.name: border-box
values.prose: The painted content is restricted to (clipped to) the border box.

values.name: fill-box
values.prose: The painted content is restricted to (clipped to) the object bounding box.

values.name: stroke-box
values.prose: The painted content is restricted to (clipped to) the stroke bounding box.

values.name: view-box
values.prose: Uses the nearest SVG viewport as reference box. If a viewBox attribute is specified for the SVG viewport creating element: The reference box is positioned at the origin of the coordinate system established by the viewBox attribute. The dimension of the reference box is set to the width and height values of the viewBox attribute.

values.name: no-clip
values.prose: The painted content is not restricted (not clipped).

properties.name: mask-origin
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

values.name: content-box
values.prose: The position is relative to the content box.

values.name: padding-box
values.prose: The position is relative to the padding box. (For single boxes 0 0 is the upper left corner of the padding edge, 100% 100% is the lower right corner.)

values.name: border-box
values.prose: The position is relative to the border box.

values.name: fill-box
values.prose: The position is relative to the object bounding box.

values.name: stroke-box
values.prose: The position is relative to the stroke bounding box.

values.name: view-box
values.prose: Uses the nearest SVG viewport as reference box. If a viewBox attribute is specified for the SVG viewport creating element: The reference box is positioned at the origin of the coordinate system established by the viewBox attribute. The dimension of the reference box is set to the width and height values of the viewBox attribute.

properties.name: mask-size
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
properties.computedValue: as specified, but with lengths made absolute

properties.name: mask-composite
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements without the defs element and all graphics elements

values.name: add
values.prose: The source is placed over the destination. (See Porter-Duff compositing operator source over for more details.)

values.name: subtract
values.prose: The source is placed, where it falls outside of the destination. (See Porter-Duff compositing operator source out for more details.)

values.name: intersect
values.prose: The parts of source that overlap the destination, replace the destination. (See Porter-Duff compositing operator source in .)

values.name: exclude
values.prose: The non-overlapping regions of source and destination are combined. (See Porter-Duff compositing operator XOR.)

properties.name: mask
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

properties.name: mask-border-source
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
properties.computedValue: they keyword none or the computed <image>

properties.name: mask-border-mode
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

values.name: alpha
values.prose: A value of alpha indicates that the alpha values of the mask border image should be used as the mask values. See Calculating mask values.

values.name: luminance
values.prose: A value of luminance indicates that the luminance values of the mask border image should be used as the mask values. See Calculating mask values.

properties.name: mask-border-slice
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
properties.percentages: refer to size of the mask border image

values.name: fill
values.prose: This property specifies inward offsets from the top, right, bottom, and left edges of the mask border image, dividing it into nine regions: four corners, four edges and a middle. The middle image part is discarded and treated as fully opaque white (the content covered by the middle part is not masked and shines through) unless the fill keyword is present.

properties.name: mask-border-width
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
properties.percentages: relative to width/height of the mask border image area
properties.computedValue: all <length>s made absolute, otherwise as specified

properties.name: mask-border-outset
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
properties.computedValue: all <length>s made absolute, otherwise as specified

properties.name: mask-border-repeat
properties.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

properties.name: mask-border
properties.appliesTo: See individual properties

properties.name: mask-type
properties.appliesTo: mask elements

values.name: luminance
values.prose: Indicates that the luminance values of the mask should be used.

values.name: alpha
values.prose: Indicates that the alpha values of the mask should be used.

properties.name: clip
properties.appliesTo: Absolutely positioned elements. In SVG, it applies to elements which establish a new viewport, pattern elements and mask elements.

values.name: <top>
values.prose: <top>, <right>, <bottom>, and <left> may either have a <length> value or auto. Negative lengths are permitted. The value auto means that a given edge of the clipping region will be the same as the edge of the elementâ€™s generated border box (i.e., auto means the same as 0 for <top> and <left>, the same as the used value of the height plus the sum of vertical padding and border widths for <bottom>, and the same as the used value of the width plus the sum of the horizontal padding and border widths for <right>, such that four auto values result in the clipping region being the same as the elementâ€™s border box).

values.name: <right>
values.prose: <top>, <right>, <bottom>, and <left> may either have a <length> value or auto. Negative lengths are permitted. The value auto means that a given edge of the clipping region will be the same as the edge of the elementâ€™s generated border box (i.e., auto means the same as 0 for <top> and <left>, the same as the used value of the height plus the sum of vertical padding and border widths for <bottom>, and the same as the used value of the width plus the sum of the horizontal padding and border widths for <right>, such that four auto values result in the clipping region being the same as the elementâ€™s border box).

values.name: <bottom>
values.prose: <top>, <right>, <bottom>, and <left> may either have a <length> value or auto. Negative lengths are permitted. The value auto means that a given edge of the clipping region will be the same as the edge of the elementâ€™s generated border box (i.e., auto means the same as 0 for <top> and <left>, the same as the used value of the height plus the sum of vertical padding and border widths for <bottom>, and the same as the used value of the width plus the sum of the horizontal padding and border widths for <right>, such that four auto values result in the clipping region being the same as the elementâ€™s border box).

values.name: <left>
values.prose: <top>, <right>, <bottom>, and <left> may either have a <length> value or auto. Negative lengths are permitted. The value auto means that a given edge of the clipping region will be the same as the edge of the elementâ€™s generated border box (i.e., auto means the same as 0 for <top> and <left>, the same as the used value of the height plus the sum of vertical padding and border widths for <bottom>, and the same as the used value of the width plus the sum of the horizontal padding and border widths for <right>, such that four auto values result in the clipping region being the same as the elementâ€™s border box).

warnings.name: userSpaceOnUse
warnings.prose: The contents of the clipPath represent values in the current user coordinate system in place at the time when the clipPath element is referenced (i.e., the user coordinate system for the element referencing the clipPath element via the clip-path property).

warnings.name: objectBoundingBox
warnings.prose: The coordinate system has its origin at the top left corner of the bounding box of the element to which the clipping path applies to and the same width and height of this bounding box. User coordinates are sized equivalently to the CSS px unit.

warnings.name: userSpaceOnUse
warnings.prose: x, y, width and height represent values in the current user coordinate system [CSS3-TRANSFORMS] in place at the time when the mask element is referenced (i.e., the user coordinate system for the element referencing the mask element via the mask property).

warnings.name: objectBoundingBox
warnings.prose: x, y, width and height represent fractions or percentages of the object bounding box of the element to which the mask is applied. User coordinates are sized equivalently to the CSS px unit.

warnings.name: userSpaceOnUse
warnings.prose: The user coordinate system for the contents of the mask element is the current user coordinate system in place at the time when the mask element is referenced (i.e., the user coordinate system for the element referencing the mask element via the mask property).

warnings.name: objectBoundingBox
warnings.prose: The coordinate system has its origin at the top left corner of the bounding box of the element to which the clipping path applies to and the same width and height of this bounding box. User coordinates are sized equivalently to the CSS px unit.
